results.title: Picture palaces
results.brief_description:
Black and white photos of movie houses from Melbourne’s recent past including the State Theatre, Capitol, Regent and Hoyts.

Part One of the project(delivered 3 Sept 2001): documentation of the photographic archive and reproduction onto digital beta.

Palaces in order of appearance:
1. Melba Theatre
2. Liberty Theatre
3. Odeon Theatre
4. Regent Theatre
5. Plaza Theatre
6. Hoyts De Lux - Bourke Street
7. Lyceum Theatre - Bourke Street
8. Capitol Theatre
9. Kings Theatre
10. Savoy Theatre
11. Palace Theatre
12. St James Theatre
13. Metro Theatre - Bourke Street
14. Grosvenor Theatre
15. Athanaeum Theatre
16. The Auditorium Theatre - Collins
17. Metro Theatre - Collins Stree circa 1941
18. Majestic Theatre
19. State Theatre
20. Forum Theatre

results.title: Picture music
results.brief_description: Presents a compilation of 20 contemporary rock-video clips. Includes such artists as Kim Carnes, Thomas Dolby, Kim Wilde, The Vapors, Hazel O’Connor Bow Wow Wow, Depeche Mode, The Tubes, Duran Duran and Kate Bush. Each video clip has its own director, no overall director or producer.

results.title: Picture Canada = Images du Canada
results.creator_credit: Bruno Rubeo, Nous Auties, All About Us and GBR
results.brief_description: Animated film showing a child’s view of the Canadian landscape through children’s paintings. There is no dialogue, only background music and sound effects.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruno Rubeo, Nous Auties, All About Us and GBR

results.title: Piccolo, saxo and company
results.creator_credit: Jan Coolen, Joop Geesink's Dollywood Productions and Philips and Company
results.brief_description: How the symphony orchestra was born. The string family of musical instruments met the brass family, and the woodwind family. They were joined by the family of drums and percussion, and eventually the Grand Piano completed the orchestra.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jan Coolen, Joop Geesink’s Dollywood Productions and Philips and Company

results.title: Physical examination
results.brief_description: A physical examination need not be a mysterious and fearful experience of young children. This film prepares the child by explaining the process, step-by-step, in a gently humorous way. Parents and medical personnel also learn how to describe examination procedures to children so that their fears and anxieties are minimized.

results.title: Physical education for children
results.creator_credit: Glenn Kirchner and Faculty of Education
results.brief_description: Shows how the basic needs and interests of primary school age children are translated into a physical education program, The nature and role of intramural activities and programs for exceptional children are also covered.

results.title: Philadelphia with love
results.creator_credit: James A. Love, Bell Telephone Company of Pennsylvania and Nassau Film Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the modern city of Philadelphia, a beneficiary of urban renewal, a city where sports and cultural opportunities are readily available. Describes the parks, museums, institutions of higher learning, the city government and the office of the mayor. “Philadelphia with love” sung by Sergio Franchi. Narration by Joel Craeger.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James A. Love, Bell Telephone Company of Pennsylvania and Nassau Film Productions
